headline: Peloton, United Airlines, Crocs: Trending Tickers
summary: Peloton (PTON) is in focus after the company projected a sales decline for the current quarter and announced more job cuts. United Airlines (UAL) temporarily grounded flights due to a software outage, delaying over 1,000 flights. Crocs (CROX) stock is plunging as the company warned that tariffs and cost-saving measures would pressure revenue. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts here.

headline: Wall Street Breakfast Podcast: Tariff Win Sends TSMC Higher
summary: TSMC climbs to record levels as Taiwan says chip giant exempt from Trump tariffs. Samsung shares rise as Apple taps Texas factory for chip supply. United Airlines resumes operations.

headline: United Airlines Resumes Flights After Tech Problem Prompts Halts
summary: United Airlines  flights started taking off again late Wednesday, a few hours after a systemwide technology issue prompted the carrier to halt departures.  “The underlying technology issue has been resolved, and, while we expect residual delays, our team is working to restore our normal operations,” United said.  United had scrubbed more than 60 mainline flights late Wednesday, with more than 1,000 delays—35% of what it had scheduled, according to flight tracking site FlightAware.
